an6.101:1: "Bhikkhus, () it is impossible that a bhikkhu who considers nibbāna to be suffering will possess a conviction in conformitywith the teaching. (2) It is impossible that one who does not possess a conviction in conformitywith the teachingwill enter upon the fixed course of rightness. (3) It is impossible that one who does not enter upon the fixed course of rightness will realize the fruit of stream-entry, (4) the fruit of once-returning, (5) the fruit of non-returning, (6) or arahantship.
an6.101:2: "Bhikkhus, (1) it is possible that a bhikkhu who considers nibbāna to be happiness will possess a conviction in conformitywith the teaching.() It is possible that one who possesses a conviction in conformitywith the teachingwill enter upon the fixed course of rightness. (3) It is possible that one who enters upon the fixed course of rightness will realize the fruit of stream-entry, (4) the fruit of once-returning, (5) the fruit of non-returning, (6) or arahantship."
